conclusion: At the entrance surface O, apply Snell’s law n_air sin α = n_core sin β.
With n_air = 1, α = 45°, n_core ≃ 1.50, one finds sin β ≃ (1/1.50)·sin 45° ≃ 0.471 → β ≃ 28°.
Inside the fibre the ray makes the same angle β with the axis (the entrance-face normal).
The side wall is perpendicular to this axis.
The incidence angle on the side (measured from the normal to that wall) is θ = 90° – β ≃ 90° – 28° ≃ 62°.
